meanings.definition: In a manner that is not just or equitable.
meanings.sent1: She was treated unfairly by her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The referee made a call that was unfairly in favor of the other team.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at me unfairly when I didn't share my sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The sun unfairly hid behind the clouds during the eclipse.
meanings.sent5: The tree unfairly blocked the view of the beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is biased or discriminatory.
meanings.sent1: He was unfairly passed over for a promotion at work.
meanings.sent2: The hiring process was unfairly skewed towards certain candidates.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked unfairly at the mailman every morning.
meanings.sent4: The wind unfairly blew the leaves in one direction only.
meanings.sent5: The rain unfairly soaked only one side of the street.
